items.description: For NCAR viscosity algorithm.

items.name: side_drag_friction_max
items.description: Maximum magnitude of the side drag induced friction. This parameter can be useful especially for pressure models where the bottom cells can be quite thin and subject to sporadic large magnitudes.  We do the same thing with bottom drag calculations. Default side_drag_friction_max=1.0.

items.name: debug_this_module
items.description: For debugging by printing checksums.

items.name: viscosity_ncar
items.description: Anisotropic background viscosities used by NCAR.

items.name: ncar_isotropic_at_depth
items.description: Sets the NCAR scheme to be isotropic beneath a chosen depth.

items.name: neptune_depth_min
items.description: Minimum depth scale used for computing Neptune velocity. Default neptune_depth_min=100.0

items.name: vel_micom_aniso
items.description: Velocity scale that is used for computing the MICOM anisotropic viscosity.

items.name: neptune
items.description: Set to true for computing friction relative to Neptune barotropic velocity. Default neptune=.false.

items.name: neptune_length_eq
items.description: Length scale used to compute Neptune velocity at equator.

items.name: visc_vel_scale_length
items.description: For NCAR viscosity algorithm: efolding depth for depth dependent background viscosity. Default visc_vel_scale_length=1500.e2 cm

items.name: ncar_isotropic_at_depth_visc
items.description: Sets the NCAR scheme to be isotropic beneath this chosen depth, with minimum viscosity set according to this value.

items.name: eq_lat_micom
items.description: Equatorial latitude band (degrees) within which the MICOM viscosity is set according to eq_vel_micom_iso and eq_vel_micom_aniso.

items.name: equatorial_no_smag
items.description: Turn smag off within equatorial_zonal_lat region.

items.name: viscosity_ncar_2007
items.description: Anisotropic background viscosities used by NCAR, using the formulation as of 2007.  Default viscosity_ncar_2007=.false.

items.name: mixdownslope_npts
items.description: Number of horizontally distant points used in search downslope. Note: it is not possible to have mixdownslope_npts greater than or equal to the computational domain extents, as this would require updates across multiple processors. Default mixdownslope_npts=1.

items.name: mixdownslope_weight_far
items.description: To place more weight on points further from central point.  This may be done to enhance properties getting downslope.  Default is mixdownslope_weight_far=.false.

items.name: use_this_module
items.description: For using this module.  Default use_this_module=.false.

items.name: do_bitwise_exact_sum
items.description: Set true to do bitwise exact global sum. When it is false, the global sum will be non-bitwise_exact, but will significantly increase efficiency. The default value is false.

items.name: mixdownslope_width
items.description: Width of the re-weighting function used to emphasize points further along in the search for exchange points.  Default mixdownslope_width=1.

items.name: mixdownslope_mask_gfdl
items.description: For modifying the mixdownslope mask based on reading in the GFDL regional mask. Default mixdownslope_mask_gfdl=.false.

items.name: mixdownslope_frac_central
items.description: Fraction of the central cell that participates in downslope mixing in any particular direction.  Default mixdownslope_frac_central=0.25

items.name: debug_this_module
items.description: For debugging

items.name: read_mixdownslope_mask
items.description: For reading in a mask that selects regions of the domain where mixdownslope is allowed to function (mask=1) or not to function (mask=0). Default read_mixdownslope_mask=.false., whereby mixdownslope_mask is set to tmask(k=1).

items.name: thickness_sigma_layer
items.description: Initial thickness of the bottom sigma layer.

items.name: tmask_sigma_on
items.description: IF .true. then masks out fluxes passing into the sigma layer, except those associated with sigma transport. Typically set to .false.

items.name: sigma_umax
items.description: Maximum downslope speed allowed in sigma layer. In some cases, the model will be unstable if sigma_umax is too large.

items.name: tracer_mix_micom
items.description: If .true., then the sigma diffusivity is set according to a velocity scale times the grid spacing.

items.name: campingoose_mu
items.description: Dissipation rate for the bottom friction.  Campin and Goosse suggest campingoose_mu=10^-4

items.name: use_this_module
items.description: Must be true to use this module. Default is false.

items.name: sigma_diffusivity
items.description: Sigma tracer diffusivity for use if not using micom diffusivity.

items.name: smooth_sigma_velocity
items.description: To smooth the sigma advective transport velocity. Default is smooth_sigma_velocity=.true.

items.name: debug_this_module
items.description: For debugging.

items.name: sigma_just_in_bottom_cell
items.description: For just having sigma layer in the bottom cell, as in mom4p0. This option must be .false. in order to use sigma_advection_on=.true. Default sigma_just_in_bottom_cell=.true.

items.name: sigma_diffusivity_ratio
items.description: When flow along sigma surface is stable (i.e., heavy parcels are below lighter parcels) then sigma diffusivity is reduced by sigma_diffusivity_ratio from the case where heavy parcels are above lighter parcels.

items.name: campingoose_delta
items.description: Fraction of a grid cell participating in the overflow process. Campin and Goosse suggest campingoose_delta=1/3.

items.name: sigma_diffusion_on
items.description: For using sigma diffusion. Default is true.

items.name: smooth_sigma_thickness
items.description: To smooth the sigma thickness. This may be needed especially for case with sigma advection, in which case the thickness can become noisy. Default is smooth_sigma_thickness=.true.

items.name: thickness_sigma_min
items.description: Minimum thickness of the bottom sigma layer.

items.name: sigma_advection_on
items.description: For using sigma advection. Default is false.

items.name: thickness_sigma_max
items.description: Maximum thickness of the bottom sigma layer.

items.name: sigma_advection_sgs_only
items.description: In many cases, adding the resolved transport to the sigma-advective transport produces a tremendous level of noise at the bottom.  The problem is that there are grid-scale features that may cause large jumps in whether the velocity should be added or not, depending on the logic of the scheme.  For this reason, it may be prudent to remove the resolved velocity from that contributing to the sigma transport scheme. Note that its removal from sigma transport does not remove the contributions of the resolved velocity from the resolved advective transport arising from ocean_tracer_advect_mod. It simply removes it from the added transport arising in the sigma transport module. Default is sigma_advection_sgs_only=.true.

items.name: sigma_advection_check
items.description: If true, then will only include the resolved advection velocity in the sigma-layer if the direction of transport is downslope favorable for enhancing deep density. IF false, then will include the velocity regardless. This option aims to reduce the large divergences that occur for the case when only include the velocity if it is favorable for deep water getting more dense. Default is sigma_advection_check=.true.

items.name: vel_micom
items.description: Velocity scale that is used for computing the MICOM diffusivity.

items.name: front_length_deform_radius
items.description: To compute the front length using the mixed layer deformation radius. Default front_length_deform_radius=.true.  Note, will have a floor on the variable front length set by the nml setting for front_length_const.

items.name: diag_step
items.description: Number of time steps between computing max bottom value for wrho_bt_submeso. Default diag_step=1200.

items.name: smooth_hblt_num
items.description: Number of iterations for the smooothing of bldepth. Default smooth_hblt_num=1.

items.name: submeso_diffusion
items.description: For computing a horizontal diffusive flux in the boundary layer as determined by the strength of the vector streamfunction. Default submeso_diffusion=.false.

items.name: smooth_advect_transport_num
items.description: Number of iterations for the smooothing of horizontal transport. Default smooth_advect_transport_num=2.

items.name: submeso_advect_zero_bdy
items.description: For removing the advective transport next to boundaries. This is useful since computation of the advective transport velocity components can be problematic next to boundaries. Default submeso_advect_zero_bdy=.false.

items.name: limit_psi_velocity_scale
items.description: Velocity scale used to limit the value of psi when limit_psi=.true. Default limit_psi_velocity_scale=5.0

items.name: submeso_advect_limit
items.description: For limiting the value of the horizontal transports to be less than a velocity scale set by limit_psi_velocity_scale. This option is not needed if limit_psi=.true. Default submeso_advect_limit=.false.

items.name: submeso_advect_upwind
items.description: For computing the tendency as convergence of a first order advective flux. Default submeso_advect_upwind=.true.

items.name: debug_this_module
items.description: For debugging purposes.

items.name: constant_hblt
items.description: The boundary layer depth for the case when use_hblt_constant=.true. Default constant_hblt=100.0.

items.name: coefficient_ce
items.description: The dimensionless coefficient from the Fox-Kemper etal scheme. They recommend setting coefficient_ce between 0.06 and 0.08. Default coefficient_ce=0.07.

items.name: use_hblt_constant
items.description: For running with a constant boundary layer depth. This for the case when not using a realistic mixed layer scheme.  Default use_hblt_constant=.false.

items.name: limit_psi
items.description: For limiting the magnitude of psi in order to reduce possibility of model crashes. Rescales the full psi to maintain vertical structure but to keep overall magnitude within bounds. Default limit_psi=.false.

items.name: smooth_hblt
items.description: For smoothing on the submeso bldepth field. This is useful since the bldepth obtained from KPP or diagnosed mld can have some grid noise. Default smooth_hblt=.false. since this agrees with legacy. Note that this scheme fails to reproduce across processor layout, so it remains broken.

items.name: minimum_hblt
items.description: For setting a floor to the hblt used for submesoscale scheme. Default minimum_hblt=0.0.

items.name: submeso_advect_flux
items.description: For computing the tendency as convergence of advective flux. This approach uses either a flux limited sweby advection or first order upwind, both of which ensure that the resulting tendency will not create extrema in the tracer field. Default submeso_advect_flux=.false.

items.name: submeso_skew_flux
items.description: For computing the tendency as convergence of skew flux. This is the recommended method. Default submeso_skew_flux=.true.

items.name: use_psi_legacy
items.description: For computing psi using older legacy methods. These methods are not ideal, and can be problematic depending on nml settings for the limiters and smoothers. This option is retained only for legacy purposes. Default use_psi_legacy=.false.

items.name: submeso_advect_sweby
items.description: For computing the tendency as convergence of a sweby advective flux. This routine is incomplete and has a bug. Default submeso_advect_sweby=.false.

items.name: smooth_advect_transport
items.description: For doing a horizontal 1-2-1 smoothing on the diagnosed uhrho_et_submeso and vhrho_nt_submeso fields. Default smooth_advect_transport=.true.

items.name: submeso_diffusion_biharmonic
items.description: The default submeso diffusion is Laplacian. However, one may wish to use a biharmonic mixing operator instead. Default submeso_diffusion_biharmonic=.false.

items.name: min_kblt
items.description: The minimum number of vertical cells in the surface boundary layer that are required in order to compute the submesoscale streamfunction. Default min_kblt=4.  Need at least three to fit a parabola with zero streamfunction at the top and bottom of the boundary layer.

items.name: front_length_const
items.description: Take constant horizontal length scale of submesoscale front. Default front_length_const=5e3.

items.name: submeso_diffusion_scale
items.description: A dimensionless scaling to be used for scaling up or down the effects from horizontal diffusion in the boundary layer. Default submeso_diffusion_scale=1.0.

items.name: use_hblt_equal_mld
items.description: For using the diagnosed mld as the hblt for submeso. This is useful for those test models that do not have a mixed layer scheme enabled, such as KPP, where the mixed layer scheme provides a boundary layer depth.  In this case, it is sensible to employ the diagnosed mixed layer depth for the submeso scheme. Additionally, in general it is more physical to use the mld than the KPP hblt as the depth over which the submesoscale eddies act.  Hence, default use_hblt_equal_mld=.true.

items.name: submeso_limit_flux
items.description: For limiting the fluxes arising from submeso scheme, according to tmask_limit. When reach a point where tmask_limit=1.0, then set the submeso flux for this cell to zero. Default submeso_limit_flux=.true.

items.name: time_constant
items.description: Timescale to mix momentum across the mixed layer. Default time_constant=86400.0 = 1day.

items.name: smooth_psi_num
items.description: Number of iterations for the smooothing of psi. Default smooth_psi_num=2.

items.name: smooth_psi
items.description: For doing a horizontal 1-2-1 smoothing on the psix_horz and psiy_horz fields. Default smooth_psi=.true.

items.name: use_this_module
items.description: Must be true to use this module. Default use_this_module=.false.

items.name: write_a_restart
items.description: Set true to write a restart.  False setting only for rare cases where wish to benchmark model without measuring the cost of writing restarts and associated chksums. Default is write_a_restart=.true.

items.name: use_nphysicsB
items.description: For using the nphysicsB method of neutral physics.  This method is experimental, and is not recommended for general use. Default use_nphysicsB=.false.

items.name: use_nphysicsC
items.description: For using the nphysicsC method of neutral physics.  This method is experimental, and is not recommended for general use. Default use_nphysicsC=.false.

items.name: debug_this_module
items.description: For printing starting and ending checksums for restarts Default debug_this_module=.false.

items.name: use_nphysicsA
items.description: For using the nphysicsA method of neutral physics, based on that developed in MOM4.0.  This scheme is more robust and recommended for general use.  Default use_nphysicsA=.true.

items.name: diffusion_all_explicit
items.description: To compute K33 explicitly in time.  This setting is meant only for debugging tests, since in general the simulation will go unstable. Default diffusion_all_explicit=.false.

items.name: neutral_physics_limit
items.description: Revert to horizontal diffusion when tracer falls outside specified range. Default neutral_physics_limit=.true., so to keep tracers from going too far outside of physical range.

items.name: use_this_module
items.description: Must be set .true. to use this module. Default use_this_module = .false.

items.name: vel_micom_smooth
items.description: For horizontal smoothing of drhodz before computing neutral slopes. Default vel_micom_smooth=0.2.

items.name: smax
items.description: Slope maximum parameter for setting behaviour of neutral physics. Default smax=0.01.

items.name: drhodz_smooth_vert
items.description: For smoothing vertical density gradient before computing neutral slope.  Exercise caution if using this option. Default drhodz_smooth_vert=.false.

items.name: drhodz_smooth_horz
items.description: For smoothing vertical density gradient before computing neutral slope.  Exercise caution if using this option. Default drhodz_smooth_horz=.false.

items.name: bvp_constant_speed
items.description: For taking a constant speed to be used for the calculation of the BVP streamfunction. Default bvp_constant_speed=.false.

items.name: smax_psi
items.description: Maximum slope used for setting the overall scale of a modal contribution to the parameterized transport. Default smax_psi=0.1.

items.name: bvp_min_speed
items.description: For setting a minimum speed for use with the calculation of the BVP streamfunction. We need  bvp_min_speed>0 to ensure that the second order derivative operator contributes to the calculation of the streamfunction. Default bvp_min_speed=0.1.

items.name: bvp_speed
items.description: For setting the speed weighting the second order derivative operator in the BVP streamfunction method: c^2 = max[bvp_min_speed, (bvp_speed-c_mode)^2]. If bvp_constant_speed, then  c^2 = bvp_speed^2. Default bvp_speed=0.0, in which case c^2 = c_mode^2.

items.name: bc_modes_transport
items.description: To compute tendency from GM skewsion using streamfunction established by baroclinic modes. Default bc_modes_transport=.false.

items.name: gm_transport
items.description: To compute tendency from GM skewsion. Default gm_transport=.false.

items.name: bvp_transport
items.description: To compute tendency from GM skewsion using streamfunction established by a boundary value problem. Default bvp_transport=.false.

items.name: smooth_transport
items.description: For doing a horizontal 1-2-1 smoothing on the psix and psiy fields. This is useful to reduce noise. Default smooth_psi=.true.

items.name: bvp_bc_mode
items.description: The particular baroclinic mode used to construct the BVP streamfunction. If bvp_bc_mode=0, then will set bc_speed=0 when computing the BVP streamfunction. Default bvp_bc_mode=1.

items.name: regularize_transport
items.description: To reduce the magnitude of psi in regions of weak stratification, using the slope = smax_psi to set the overall scale of the max allowed for psi. Default regularize_transport=.true.

items.name: number_bc_modes
items.description: The number of baroclinic modes used to construct the eddy induced streamfunction when bc_modes_transport. Default number_bc_modes=1.

items.name: ahb
items.description: ahb = adjustable parameter at the bottom for bryan_lewis_aredi

items.name: agm_damping_time
items.description: The damping time used for time smoothing agm_array. Default agm_damping_time=10days.

items.name: agm_closure_grid_scaling_power
items.description: Power used to scale the agm_closure diffusivity. Default is agm_closure_grid_scaling_power=2.0

items.name: agm_closure_length_cap
items.description: For setting a maximum length scale for the agm_closure calculation. Default agm_closure_length_cap=.false.

items.name: agm_closure_n2_scale
items.description: For computing the agm coefficient using a 3-dimensional scaling by (N/Nref)^2, with N=buoyancy frequency and Nref the buoyancy frequency at the base of the neutral blayer. Default agm_closure_n2_scale=.false.

items.name: agm_closure_growth_scale
items.description: Dimensionless scaling used to set a maximum for agm_growth.

items.name: smax
items.description: Value of the maximum neutral direction slope above which the neutral fluxes are either tapered to zero or saturated.  Typical value is smax=0.01 or smaller.

items.name: aredi_diffusivity_grid_scaling
items.description: For an overall scaling of the aredi coefficient, according to the relative resolution of the grid and deformation radius. This option is used only when aredi_equal_agm=.false. Default is aredi_diffusivity_grid_scaling=.false.

items.name: ahs
items.description: ahs = adjustable parameter at the surface for bryan_lewis_aredi

items.name: agm_closure_eden_length
items.description: Length scale for use with agm_closure_eden_length_const=.true. Default agm_closure_eden_length=10e3.

items.name: agm_smooth_time
items.description: For smoothing the agm diffusivity in time when nonconstant diffusivity used. Default is agm_smooth_time=.false.

items.name: aredi
items.description: Neutral diffusivity used for experiments using a constant diffusivity.

items.name: agm_closure_eden_greatbatch
items.description: For computing the agm_closure length scale according to minimum of the Rhines scale and the Rossby radius, and using 3d Eady growth rate.

items.name: agm_closure_eady_smooth_horz
items.description: For horizontal Laplacian smoothing of eady growth rate. Default agm_closure_eady_smooth_horz=.false.

items.name: agm_closure_length_bczone
items.description: For computing the agm_closure length scale according to radius of baroclinic zone.

items.name: tracer_mix_micom
items.description: If .true., then the GM-skew diffusivity is set according to a velocity scale times the grid spacing.

items.name: agm_closure_min
items.description: Minimum GM diffusivity allowed when using agm_closure=.true.

items.name: smooth_eta_tend_gm90
items.description: For smoothing the diagnosed contribution to steric sea level time tendency associated with the GM90 scheme. Default is smooth_eta_tend_gm90=.false.

items.name: epsln_drhodz
items.description: For computing drhodz used in slope calculation. We must keep drhodz < 0 in order to maintain integrity of the quasi-Stokes streamfunction as well as computation of buoyancy frequency. Default epsln_drhodz=1e-30.

items.name: agm_closure_eady_ave_mixed
items.description: To set the Eady growth rate to its average within mixed layer region. This is used to avoid spuriously large values which often appear just in the upper regions of the ocean mixed layer. Default agm_closure_eady_ave_mixed=.false.

items.name: agm_closure_baroclinic
items.description: For computing the agm coefficient using only the vertically averaged magnitude of the horizontal density gradient (i.e., the "baroclinicity").

items.name: smax_grad_gamma_scalar
items.description: For calculation of gradients of scalars along a neutral direction, then when abs(slope) > smax_grad_gamma_scalar, will compute the gradient using only the vertical scalar gradient, since the slopes are so large they are effectively infinite. Default smax_grad_gamma_scalar=.01

items.name: drhodz_smooth_horz
items.description: For horizontal laplacian smoothing the vertical derivative of density prior to its use in computing the neutral slopes. This smoothing helps to produce regularized slopes. Note that this option breaks the integrity of the triads and is thus NOT generally recommended. Default drhodz_smooth_horz=.false.

items.name: vel_micom_smooth
items.description: Velocity scale that is used for computing the MICOM Laplacian mixing coefficient used in smoothing of drhodzb. Default vel_micom_smooth=0.2.

items.name: ah_bdy
items.description: Constant horizontal diffusivity for the boundary layer. Default ah_bdy=0.0.

items.name: bczone_max_pts
items.description: Max number of horizontal grid points for use in computing the baroclinic zone radius.

items.name: wdianeutral_smooth
items.description: For smoothing the diagnosed dianeutral velocity component using a horizontal 1-2-1 smoother. Default is wdianeutral_smooth=.true.

items.name: agm_closure
items.description: If .true. then will compute the GM-skew diffusivity as a function of the flow. The length scale is determined by the Rossby radius and the time scale is determined by the Eady growth rate.  Diffusivities are depth independent.

items.name: aredi_equal_agm
items.description: Will set aredi_array=agm_array, over-riding any other specification of aredi_array. Default aredi_equal_agm=.true.

items.name: agm_closure_n2_scale_nref_cst
items.description: For taking the reference buoyancy frequency as agm_closure_buoy_freq for the (N/Nref)^2 scaling. Default agm_closure_n2_scale_nref_cst=.false.

items.name: neutral_horz_mix_bdy
items.description: If .true., then use a horizontal diffusivity in the neutral boundary layer.

items.name: bryan_lewis_aredi
items.description: Set bryan_lewis_aredi=.true. when want to have aredi a function of depth according to the Bryan and Lewis (1979) profile. Maintained for legacy purposes, and not recommended for new models.

items.name: nphysics_util_zero_init
items.description: For Time%init=.true. and wishing to ensure starting with a clean suite of nphysics_util fields, even if ocean_neutral.res.nc exists.

items.name: agm_closure_length_fixed
items.description: Use fixed length scale for computing agm_closure diffusivity

items.name: agm_closure_eady_smooth_vert
items.description: For vertical 1-2-1 smoothing the eady_rate Default agm_closure_eady_smooth=.false.

items.name: agm_smooth_space
items.description: For smoothing the agm diffusivity in space when nonconstant diffusivity used. Default is agm_smooth_space=.false.

items.name: agm_read_restart
items.description: For those cases with agm_closure=.false. where we wish to read in the agm_array from restart files and keep the value from the restart. This approach allows us to read in a spatially dependent agm_array that may have been computed from another integration, but to leave the coefficient static in time. Default agm_read_restart=.false.

items.name: agm_closure_n2_scale_coeff
items.description: Coefficient setting the scale for the diffusivity computed from agm_closure_n2_scale. Default agm_closure_n2_scale_coeff=1e3.

items.name: swidth
items.description: Width in slope over which use tanh with dm_taper scheme to taper fluxes in steep sloped regions. Typical value swidth=0.1*smax

items.name: agm_closure_lower_depth
items.description: Deeper depth where finish the depth integration to compute the Eady growth rate and/or baroclinicity.

items.name: rossby_radius_max
items.description: Maximum Rossby radius used for agm_closure_length_rossby and the neutral_sine_taper. Default = 100e3 m.

items.name: agm_closure_max
items.description: Maximum GM diffusivity allowed when using agm_closure=.true.

items.name: agm_closure_eden_gamma
items.description: For use in regularizing the growth rate used in the eden/greatbatch approach. Default agm_closure_eden_gamma=200. Setting to zero removes the regularization.

items.name: debug_this_module
items.description: For printing starting and ending checksums for restarts

items.name: agm_closure_eady_cap
items.description: For capping the eady growth rate to avoid huge values. Default agm_closure_eady_cap=.false.

items.name: agm
items.description: GM-skew diffusivity used for experiments using a constant diffusivity.

items.name: rossby_radius_min
items.description: Minimum Rossby Radius used for agm_closure_length_rossby and the neutral_sine_taper. Default = 15e3 m.

items.name: agm_closure_grid_scaling
items.description: For an overall scaling of the agm coefficient, according to the relative resolution of the grid and deformation radius. Default is agm_closure_grid_scaling=.false.

items.name: epsln_drhodz_diagnostics
items.description: For drhodz used in calculation of dianeutral velocity component from cabbeling and thermobaricity. Default epsln_drhodz_diagnostics=1e-7.

items.name: agm_closure_scaling
items.description: Dimensionless tuning parameter for computing flow dependent diffusivities.

items.name: agm_closure_length_max
items.description: Maximum length scale used for computing agm_closure. Default agm_closure_length_max=50e3.

items.name: drhodz_mom4p1
items.description: For computing the vertical deriviative of locally referenced potrho as in the preferred MOM algorithm rather than the earlier mom4p0 approach. Default drhodz_mom4p1=.true.

items.name: agm_closure_length_rossby
items.description: For computing the agm_closure length scale according to Rossby radius.

items.name: agm_closure_bczone_crit_rate
items.description: Critical growth rate for determining width of the baroclinic zone.

items.name: vel_micom_bdy
items.description: Velocity scale that is used for computing the MICOM horizontal diffusivity within the neutral boundary layer.

items.name: drhodz_smooth_vert
items.description: For vertical 1-2-1 smoothing the vertical derivative of density prior to its use in computing the neutral slopes. This smoothing helps to produce regularized slopes. Note that this option breaks the integrity of the triads and is thus NOT generally recommended. Default drhodz_smooth_vert=.false.

items.name: agm_closure_eden_length_const
items.description: To set the length scale for agm_closure_eden_greatbatch to constant. Default agm_closure_eden_length_const=.false.

items.name: agm_closure_length
items.description: Fixed length scale for use with agm_closure_fixed_length

items.name: agm_closure_buoy_freq
items.description: For computing the agm coefficient using only the vertically averaged horizontal density gradient, we need to specify a buoyancy frequency,  which is taken to be fixed over all space-time.

items.name: agm_closure_upper_depth
items.description: Upper depth where start the depth integration to compute the Eady growth rate and/or baroclinicity.

items.name: vel_micom
items.description: Velocity scale that is used for computing the MICOM diffusivity.

items.name: num_121_passes
items.description: For number of 1-2-1 passes through to smooth drhodz or eady_rate in vertical. Default num_121_passes=1.

items.name: num_121_passes
items.description: For number of 1-2-1 passes through to smooth drhodz or eady_rate in vertical. Default num_121_passes=1.

items.name: use_gm_skew
items.description: Must be true to use GM skewsion.  Set to false if wish to incorporate the "GM-effect" through form drag, as in ocean_form_drag module. Default use_gm_skew=.true.

items.name: gkw_taper
items.description: Set to true to use the quadradic tapering scheme of Gerdes, Koberle, and Willebrand. Default is false.

items.name: use_this_module
items.description: Must be true to use this module. Default is false.

items.name: diffusion_all_explicit
items.description: To compute all contributions from neutral diffusion explicitly in time, including the K33 diagonal piece.  This approach is available only when have small time steps and/or running with just a single tracer.  It is for testing purposes.

items.name: neutral_taper_diagonal
items.description: For cases with neutral_physics_simple=.false., then neutral_taper_diagonal=.true. will taper the diagonal pieces of the horizontal flux components when neutral slopes are steep. With neutral_taper_diagonal=.false., then the horizontal flux components will remain enabled for all slopes, thus producing horizontal downgradient diffusion in regions of vertical neutral directions.

items.name: neutral_sine_taper
items.description: If .true. then with neutral_physics_simple=.false., will apply a sine-taper to GM and neutral diffusive fluxes in regions where the penetration depth of eddies is deeper than the grid point. This method is essential for fine vertical resolution grids.

items.name: dm_taper
items.description: Set to true to use the tanh tapering scheme of Danabasoglu and McWilliams. Default is true.

items.name: turb_blayer_min
items.description: Minimum depth of a surface turbulent boundary layer used in the transition of the neutral physics fluxes to the surface.  Note that in MOM4.0, turb_blayer_min was always set to zero.

items.name: neutral_blayer_diagnose
items.description: Diagnose properties of the neutral physics boundary layer, whether have neutral_linear_gm_taper or neutral_sine_taper true or not.

items.name: neutral_physics_simple
items.description: If .true. then must have aredi_equal_agm=.true..  The horizontal fluxes are then computed as horizontal downgradient diffusive fluxes regardless the neutral slope. This approach precluds one from being able to have the GM-skew fluxes remain active in the steep sloped regions, thus shutting off their effects to reduce the slopes of isopycnals in convective and mixed layer regimes.  It is for this reason that neutral_physics_simple=.false. is the recommended default in MOM.

items.name: neutral_physics_limit
items.description: When tracer falls outside a specified range, revert to horizontal diffusive fluxes at this cell. This is an ad hoc and incomplete attempt to maintain monotonicity with the neutral physics scheme. Default neutral_physics_limit=.true.

items.name: debug_this_module
items.description: For printing starting and ending checksums for restarts

items.name: tmask_neutral_on
items.description: If .true. then this logical reduces the neutral fluxes to horizontal/vertical diffusion next to boundaries. This approach has been found to reduce spurious extrema resulting from truncation of triads used to compute a neutral flux component. Default tmask_neutral_on=.false.

items.name: neutral_linear_gm_taper
items.description: If .true. then with neutral_physics_simple=.false., will linearly taper GM skew fluxes towards the surface within regions of steep neutral slopes. This approach leads to a constant horizontal eddy-induced velocity in the steeply sloping regions and is recommended for realistic simulations.

items.name: use_gm_skew
items.description: Must be true to use GM skewsion.  Set to false if wish to incorporate the "GM-effect" through form drag, as in ocean_form_drag module. Default use_gm_skew=.true.

items.name: use_this_module
items.description: Must be true to use this module. Default is false.

items.name: surf_turb_thick_min_k
items.description: Minimum number of k-levels in surface turbulent boundary layer used in the transition of the neutral physics fluxes to the surface. Default surf_turb_thick_min_k = 2.

items.name: surf_turb_thick_min
items.description: Minimum thickness of surface turbulent boundary layer used in the transition of the neutral physics fluxes to the surface. Default surf_turb_thick_min=20m.

items.name: neutral_damping_time
items.description: The damping time used for determining the effective surface boundary layer thickness from other portions of the model. Default neutral_damping_time=10days.

items.name: nblayer_smooth
items.description: For smoothing the neutral blayer fields. This is useful when aiming to produce a smooth quasi-stokes streamfunction within the boundary layers. Default is nblayer_smooth=.true.

items.name: neutral_physics_limit
items.description: When tracer falls outside a specified range, revert to horizontal diffusive fluxes at this cell. This is an ad hoc and incomplete attempt to maintain monotonicity with the neutral physics scheme. Default neutral_physics_limit=.true.

items.name: debug_this_module
items.description: For printing starting and ending checksums for restarts

items.name: tmask_neutral_on
items.description: If .true. then this logical reduces the neutral fluxes to horizontal/vertical diffusion next to boundaries. This approach has been found to reduce spurious extrema resulting from truncation of triads used to compute a neutral flux component.  Default tmask_neutral_on=.false.

items.name: vel_micom_smooth
items.description: Velocity scale that is used for computing the MICOM Laplacian mixing coefficient used in the Laplacian smoothing of neutral blayer fields.

items.name: diffusion_all_explicit
items.description: To compute all contributions from neutral diffusion explicitly in time, including the K33 diagonal piece.  This approach is available only when have small time steps and/or running with just a single tracer.  It is for testing purposes.

items.name: neutral_slopes_potrho_press
items.description: The reference pressure used to compute neutral slopes when setting use_neutral_slopes_potrho=.true. Default neutral_slopes_potrho_press=2000.0

items.name: diffusion_all_explicit
items.description: To compute all contributions from neutral diffusion explicitly in time, including the K33 diagonal piece.  This approach is available only when have small time steps and/or running with just a single tracer.  It is for testing purposes.

items.name: dm_taper
items.description: Set to true to use the tanh tapering scheme of Danabasoglu and McWilliams. Default is true.

items.name: neutral_eddy_depth
items.description: Compute eddy_depth according to depth over which eddies feel the ocean surface. Default neutral_eddy_depth=.true.

items.name: turb_blayer_min
items.description: Minimum depth of a surface turbulent boundary layer used in the transition of the neutral diffusion fluxes to the surface.  Note that in mom4p0, turb_blayer_min was always set to zero.

items.name: smooth_advect_transport_num
items.description: Number of iterations for the smooothing of horizontal transport. Default smooth_advect_transport_num=2.

items.name: neutral_physics_limit
items.description: When tracer falls outside a specified range, revert to horizontal diffusive fluxes at this cell. This is an ad hoc and incomplete attempt to maintain monotonicity with the neutral physics scheme. Default neutral_physics_limit=.true.

items.name: use_neutral_slopes_potrho
items.description: To compute the neutral slopes based on globally referenced potential density rather than locally referenced potential density. This approach is meant solely for sensitivity studies; it is not meant for realistic simulations. Default use_neutral_slopes_potrho=.false.

items.name: gm_skewsion_bvproblem
items.description: To compute tendency from GM skewsion using streamfunction established by a boundary value problem. Default gm_skewsion_bvproblem=.true.

items.name: epsln_bv_freq
items.description: Minimum buoyancy frequency accepted for the computation of baroclinic modes. Default epsln_bv_freq=1e-10.  Note there is also a minimum drhodz set in ocean_density.F90 via the nml epsln_drhodz in that module.  We provide yet another minimum here in case we need an extra regularization for the amplitude of the baroclinic modes.

items.name: use_this_module
items.description: Must be true to use this module. Default is false.

items.name: regularize_psi
items.description: To reduce the magnitude of psi in regions of weak stratification, using the slope = smax_psi to set the overall scale of the max allowed for psi. Default regularize_psi=.true.

items.name: debug_this_module
items.description: For printing starting and ending checksums for restarts

items.name: bvp_constant_speed
items.description: For taking a constant speed to be used for the calculation of the BVP streamfunction. Default bvp_constant_speed=.false.

items.name: bvp_min_speed
items.description: For setting a minimum speed for use with the calculation of the BVP streamfunction. We need  bvp_min_speed>0 to ensure that the second order derivative operator contributes to the calculation of the streamfunction. Default bvp_min_speed=0.1.

items.name: gkw_taper
items.description: Set to true to use the quadradic tapering scheme of Gerdes, Koberle, and Willebrand. Default is false.

items.name: smooth_bc_modes
items.description: For doing a vertical 1-2-1 smoothing on the baroclinic modes prior to normalization.  This is useful to reduce noise. Default smooth_bc_modes=.false.

items.name: tmask_neutral_on
items.description: If .true. then this logical reduces the neutral diffusive fluxes to horizontal/vertical diffusion next to boundaries. This approach has been found to reduce spurious extrema resulting from truncation of triads used to compute a neutral flux component. Default tmask_neutral_on=.false.

items.name: number_bc_modes
items.description: The number of baroclinic modes used to construct the eddy induced streamfunction. Default number_bc_modes=1.

items.name: do_gm_skewsion
items.description: To compute tendency from GM skewsion. Default do_gm_skewsion=.true.

items.name: bvp_speed
items.description: For setting the speed weighting the second order derivative operator in the BVP streamfunction method: c^2 = max[bvp_min_speed, (bvp_speed-c_mode)^2]. If bvp_constant_speed, then  c^2 = bvp_speed^2. Default bvp_speed=0.0, in which case c^2 = c_mode^2.

items.name: bv_freq_smooth_vert
items.description: To smooth the buoyancy frequency for use in computing the baroclinic modes. Generally this field has already been smooted in ocean_density_mod, but we maintain the possibility of further smoothing here.  Default bv_freq_smooth_vert=.false.

items.name: do_neutral_diffusion
items.description: To compute tendency from neutral diffusion. Default do_neutral_diffusion=.true.

items.name: smooth_advect_transport
items.description: For doing a horizontal 1-2-1 smoothing on the diagnosed uhrho_et_gm and vhrho_nt_gm fields. Default smooth_advect_transport=.true.

items.name: gm_skewsion_modes
items.description: To compute tendency from GM skewsion using streamfunction established by baroclinic modes. Default gm_skewsion_modes=.false.

items.name: bvp_bc_mode
items.description: The particular baroclinic mode used to construct the BVP streamfunction. If bvp_bc_mode=0, then will set bc_speed=0 when computing the BVP streamfunction. Default bvp_bc_mode=1.

items.name: smooth_psi
items.description: For doing a horizontal 1-2-1 smoothing on the psix and psiy fields. This is useful to reduce noise. Default smooth_psi=.true.

items.name: min_bc_speed
items.description: The minimum speed used for computing the baroclinic modes. Default min_bc_speed=1e-6

items.name: num_121_passes
items.description: The number of 121 passes used to smooth buoyancy frequency when bv_freq_smooth_vert=.true.  Default num_121_passes=1.

items.name: use_this_module
items.description: For using this module.  Default use_this_module=.false.

items.name: days_to_increment
items.description: For specifying the amount of days to restore. Default days_to_increment=1

items.name: secs_to_increment
items.description: For specifying the amount of seconds to restore. Default secs_to_increment=0

items.name: fraction_increment
items.description: For prescribing the fraction of the increment. applied to the restoring period.  Default fraction_increment=1.0

items.name: use_this_module
items.description: For using this module.  Default use_this_module=.false.

items.name: days_to_increment
items.description: For specifying the amount of days to restore. Default days_to_increment=1

items.name: secs_to_increment
items.description: For specifying the amount of seconds to restore. Default secs_to_increment=0

items.name: fraction_increment
items.description: For prescribing the fraction of the increment. applied to the restoring period.  Default fraction_increment=1.0

items.name: use_this_module
items.description: For using this module.  Default use_this_module=.false.

items.name: days_to_increment
items.description: For specifying the amount of days to restore. Default days_to_increment=1

items.name: secs_to_increment
items.description: For specifying the amount of seconds to restore. Default secs_to_increment=0

items.name: fraction_increment
items.description: For prescribing the fraction of the increment. applied to the restoring period.  Default fraction_increment=1.0

items.name: use_this_module
items.description: Needs to be true in order to use this scheme. Default is false.

items.name: rayleigh_damp_exp_from_bottom
items.description: For computing a Rayleigh damping time with largest at bottom and decaying towards surface.

items.name: verbose_init
items.description: For verbose initialization information.

items.name: use_rayleigh_damp_table
items.description: For reading in Rayleigh damping times from a table.

items.name: debug_this_module
items.description: For debugging.

items.name: rayleigh_damp_exp_scale
items.description: Exponential decay scale from bottom upwards for computing the Rayleigh damping time.

items.name: overexch_width
items.description: Width of the re-weighting function used to emphasize the points further along in the search for exchange points.  Default overexch_width=1.

items.name: overflow_delta
items.description: Fraction of a grid cell participating in the overflow process. Campin and Goosse suggest overflow_delta=1/3.

items.name: use_this_module
items.description: For using this module.  Default use_this_module=.false.

items.name: overflow_umax
items.description: Maximum downslope speed used for determining the exchange rate. Default overflow_umax=1.0.

items.name: do_bitwise_exact_sum
items.description: Set true to do bitwise exact global sum. When it is false, the global sum will be non-bitwise_exact, but will significantly increase efficiency. The default value is false.

items.name: overexch_min_thickness
items.description: Minimum bottom cell thickness allowed for use of this scheme. Have found that with very thin cells, the model can become very unstable.  Default overexch_min_thickness=4.0

items.name: overexch_check_extrema
items.description: Check to be sure there are no global tracer extrema formed due to the overexch process. Note that this approach DOES NOT conserve tracer, so it is not generally recommended. Default overexch_check_extrema=.false.

items.name: overexch_npts
items.description: Number of points used in search for the exchange method. Default overexch_npts=1.  Note: it is not possible to have overexch_npts greater than or equal to the computational domain extents, as this would require updates across multiple processors. Default overexch_npts=1.

items.name: debug_this_module
items.description: For debugging

items.name: overflow_mu
items.description: Dissipation rate for the bottom friction.  Campin and Goosse suggest overflow_mu=10^-4

items.name: overexch_weight_far
items.description: To place more weight on points further from central point.  This may be done to enhance properties getting downslope.  Default is overexch_weight_far=.false.

items.name: overexch_stability
items.description: Stability factor for determining the maximum overexch_flux. Default overexch_stability=0.25

items.name: no_return_flow
items.description: Set true to remove the Campin and Goose return flow "piping". Default no_return_flow=.false. to recover the standard approach from Campin and Goose.

items.name: overflow_delta
items.description: Fraction of a grid cell participating in the overflow process. Campin and Goosse suggest overflow_delta=1/3.

items.name: use_this_module
items.description: For using this module.  Default is false.

items.name: overflow_umax

items.description: The default method for determination of the boundary layer depth may fail if the water column is instable (negative Richardson number) below or above the layer that contains the diagnosed hbl. With hbl_with_rit=.true. the search for the boundary layer depth is continued downward in this case even if the bulk Richardson number exceeds the critical value. This removes a lot of noise from the boundary layer depth. Default hbl_with_rit=.false.

items.description: For computing kbl as in the MOM4p0d code, which is taken from the original NCAR scheme.  If false, then will slightly modify the logic.  The modified logic has been found necessary when running with as few as two grid cells in the vertical. Default kbl_standard_method=.true.

items.description: Remove the shortwave radiation leaving the boundary layer to the ocean interior (hence, not absorbed in the boundary layer) from non-local vertical heat flux Default radiation_large=.false.

items.name: smooth_blmc
items.description: Smooth boundary layer diffusitivies to remove grid scale noise. Such noise is apparent in the diagnosed mixed layer depth as well as the SST, especially when running coupled models where forcing has high temporal frequency. Default smooth_blmc=.false.  Warning: This smoother can cause some problems with ghat in regions of zero surface forcing.  To understand details, one needs the paper of Large et al. Vertical diffusion has the general form wx = K(x_z - ghats) In the surface layer a vertical scale function ws is estimated. We have K ~ ws and ghats ~1/ws. If wind stress is zero the vertical scale ws becomes zero too. Hence, ghats is very large (something finite, since it is divided by ws+epsln). Now it may happen, that the bouyancy flux becomes negative (~ -10-30). This enables the nonlocal scheme. Because the mixing coefficient in the surface boundary layer scales with ws the corresponding time tendency should be of the order (1/ws * ws = finite). However, if smooth_blmc is enabled, it may happen, that from neighbouring points with different mixing depth a finite value for the mixing coefficient leaks in. In this case the tracer time tendency from the nonlocal scheme becomes huge and the model fails.  The smoother destroys the consistency between ghats and diff_cbt. In most cases this should not matter, but the example shows, that sudden model failure is possible under otherwise stable and smooth conditions.

items.description: Logical switch for double-diffusive mixing. Default double_diffusion=.true.

items.name: limit_with_hekman
items.description: Limiting the boundary layer depth with the Ekman depth may result in a shallow boundary layer. In this case the internal values of the vertical mixing and viscosity coefficients may be large. This results in unrealistically large non-local vertical mixing Default limit_with_hekman=.true.

items.description: logical switch for shear instability mixing. Default shear_instability=.true.

items.name: smooth_ri_kmax_eq_kmu
items.description: When smoothing the Richardson number, we do so over a vertical column with max k-levels set by either kmt or kmu.  The proper approach is kmu, since we are smoothing riu.  But for backwards compatibility, we default to smooth_ri_kmax_eq_kmu=.false.

items.name: bvf_from_below
items.description: Use BV-freq. at the cell bottom instead of the cell top as in Danabasoglu et al. (2006). Default bvf_from_below=.false., as this will recover older behaviour.

items.name: limit_ghats
items.description: Limits the non-local vertical tracer flux to the value of the tracer surface flux. Default limit_ghats=.false.

items.name: linear_hbl
items.description: Use linear interpolation to find the position of hbl. If set to false, then use the quadratic interpolation as in Danabasoglu et al. (2006). The quadratic approach generally yields a slightly deeper surface boundary layer. Default linear_hbl=.true., as this will recover older behaviour.

items.name: non_local_kpp
items.description: logical switch for enabling the non-local mixing aspect of kpp. Default is .true. as this is what the original KPP scheme suggests.

items.name: concv
items.description: constant for pure convection (eqn. 23 of Large etal)

items.name: kl_min
items.description: Lower loop index for finding new kbl. Needed for use with certain tests of OBC, where kl_min=1 needed, whereas default in original implementation has kl_min=2.  Default in MOM is kl_min=2.

items.name: diff_cbt_iw
items.description: Background vertical diffusivity.  Note that if using Bryan-Lewis as a background diffusivity, then should set diff_cbt_iw=0.0.

items.name: wsfc_combine_runoff_calve
items.description: For computing wsfc as in the MOM4p0d code, where we combine the runoff+calving into a single field called river. The alternative keeps the fields separate, as would be appropriate for a land model that separately tracks the tracer content in the calving and runoff. Default wsfc_combine_runoff_calve=.true., as this will recover the previous behaviour, to the bit.

items.name: diff_con_limit
items.description: Enhanced vertical diffusivity in regions of convection

items.name: radiation_zero
items.description: Remove the all shortwave radiation from non-local vertical heat flux. Default radiation_zero=.false.

items.name: hbl_with_rit
items.description: The default method for determination of the boundary layer depth may fail if the water column is instable (negative Richardson number) below or above the layer that contains the diagnosed hbl. With hbl_with_rit=.true. the search for the boundary layer depth is continued downward in this case even if the bulk Richardson number exceeds the critical value. This removes a lot of noise from the boundary layer depth. Default hbl_with_rit=.false.

items.name: Ricr
items.description: Critical bulk Richardson number.  Default from NCAR is 0.3, though this number has a large uncertainty and some find that 1.0 can be of use.

items.name: visc_cbu_iw
items.description: Background vertical viscosity

items.name: variable_vtc
items.description: Make vtc dependent on BV-freq. as in Danabasoglu et al. (2006). Default variable_vtc=.false., as this will recover older behaviour.

items.name: kbl_standard_method
items.description: For computing kbl as in the MOM4p0d code, which is taken from the original NCAR scheme.  If false, then will slightly modify the logic.  The modified logic has been found necessary when running with as few as two grid cells in the vertical. Default kbl_standard_method=.true.

items.name: use_this_module
items.description: Logical switch to enable kpp diffusion.  Default is false.

items.name: radiation_large
items.description: Remove the shortwave radiation leaving the boundary layer to the ocean interior (hence, not absorbed in the boundary layer) from non-local vertical heat flux Default radiation_large=.false.

items.name: smooth_blmc
items.description: Smooth boundary layer diffusitivies to remove grid scale noise. Such noise is apparent in the diagnosed mixed layer depth as well as the SST, especially when running coupled models where forcing has high temporal frequency. Default smooth_blmc=.false.  Warning: This smoother can cause some problems with ghat in regions of zero surface forcing.  To understand details, one needs the paper of Large et al. Vertical diffusion has the general form wx = K(x_z - ghats) In the surface layer a vertical scale function ws is estimated. We have K ~ ws and ghats ~1/ws. If wind stress is zero the vertical scale ws becomes zero too. Hence, ghats is very large (something finite, since it is divided by ws+epsln). Now it may happen, that the bouyancy flux becomes negative (~ -10-30). This enables the nonlocal scheme. Because the mixing coefficient in the surface boundary layer scales with ws the corresponding time tendency should be of the order (1/ws * ws = finite). However, if smooth_blmc is enabled, it may happen, that from neighbouring points with different mixing depth a finite value for the mixing coefficient leaks in. In this case the tracer time tendency from the nonlocal scheme becomes huge and the model fails.  The smoother destroys the consistency between ghats and diff_cbt. In most cases this should not matter, but the example shows, that sudden model failure is possible under otherwise stable and smooth conditions.

items.name: double_diffusion
items.description: Logical switch for double-diffusive mixing. Default double_diffusion=.true.

items.name: limit_with_hekman
items.description: Limiting the boundary layer depth with the Ekman depth may result in a shallow boundary layer. In this case the internal values of the vertical mixing and viscosity coefficients may be large. This results in unrealistically large non-local vertical mixing Default limit_with_hekman=.true.

items.name: diff_cbt_limit
items.description: Enhanced vertical diffusivity due to shear instability

items.name: debug_this_module
items.description: Logical switch for debugging. Default debug_this_module=.false.

items.name: use_max_shear
items.description: Use maximum shear instead of 4-point average (as in Danabasoglu et al. (2006)). Default use_max_shear=.false., as this will recover legacy behaviour.

items.name: radiation_iow
items.description: Keep only the shortwave radiation absorbed between the surface and a certain level in non-local vertical heat flux through this level. Default radiation_iow=.false.

items.name: visc_cbu_limit
items.description: Enhanced vertical viscosity due to shear instability

items.name: visc_con_limit
items.description: Enhanced vertical viscosity in regions of convection

items.name: shear_instability
items.description: logical switch for shear instability mixing. Default shear_instability=.true.

items.name: smooth_ri_kmax_eq_kmu
items.description: When smoothing the Richardson number, we do so over a vertical column with max k-levels set by either kmt or kmu.  The proper approach is kmu, since we are smoothing riu.  But for backwards compatibility, we default to smooth_ri_kmax_eq_kmu=.false.

items.name: bvf_from_below
items.description: Use BV-freq. at the cell bottom instead of the cell top as in Danabasoglu et al. (2006). Default bvf_from_below=.false., as this will recover older behaviour.

items.name: limit_ghats
items.description: Limits the non-local vertical tracer flux to the value of the tracer surface flux. Default limit_ghats=.false.

items.name: linear_hbl
items.description: Use linear interpolation to find the position of hbl. If set to false, then use the quadratic interpolation as in Danabasoglu et al. (2006). The quadratic approach generally yields a slightly deeper surface boundary layer. Default linear_hbl=.true., as this will recover older behaviour.

items.name: non_local_kpp
items.description: logical switch for enabling the non-local mixing aspect of kpp. Default is .true. as this is what the original KPP scheme suggests.

items.name: concv
items.description: constant for pure convection (eqn. 23 of Large etal)

items.name: kl_min
items.description: Lower loop index for finding new kbl. Needed for use with certain tests of OBC, where kl_min=1 needed, whereas default in original implementation has kl_min=2.  Default in MOM is kl_min=2.

items.name: diff_cbt_iw
items.description: Background vertical diffusivity.  Note that if using Bryan-Lewis as a background diffusivity, then should set diff_cbt_iw=0.0.

items.name: hwf_N0_2Omega
items.description: Ratio of the typical Buoyancy frequency to twice the earth's rotation period. Default hwf_N0_2Omega=20.0.

items.name: vert_mix_scheme
items.description: To determine the vertical mixing scheme: "const", "kpp", "kpp_mom4p0","kpp_mom4p1", "chen", "pp", or "gotm".

items.name: vmix_min_diss_const
items.description: Minimum dissipation rate as a constant. Default vmix_min_diss_const=1e-7.

items.name: bryan_lewis_diffusivity
items.description: If .true. then add a Bryan-Lewis background to the diffusivity.  This background is a time-independent function of depth.  This diffusivity is NOT used when have use_pp_vert_mix_coeff=.true. This scheme should NOT be used if HWF is used.

items.name: hwf_min_diffusivity
items.description: Minimum diffusivity for the HWF scheme. Default hwf_min_diffusivity=2e-6.

items.name: use_explicit_vert_diffuse
items.description: Must be true to use time-explicit vertical tracer diffusion.

items.name: diff_cbt_tanh_max
items.description: For use in setting background vertical diffusivity. Default diff_cbt_tanh_max=1e-3.

items.name: linear_taper_diff_cbt_table
items.description: If .true., then linear taper the diff_cbt_table value from so that it gets smaller with depth.

items.name: visc_cbu_back_zwid
items.description: Width of tanh function used to define background vertical viscosity.

items.name: vert_diff_back_via_max
items.description: If .true. then include a static background diffusivity via the max function, as used in mom4p0d.  The alternative is via simply adding the background to the diffusivity obtained via other approaches.  This option remains for legacy. Default is vert_diff_back_via_max=.true.

items.name: diff_cbt_tanh_zwid
items.description: Width of tanh function used to define background vertical diffusivity. Default diff_cbt_tanh_zwid=30.0.

items.name: hwf_diffusivity
items.description: 3D background diffusivity which gets smaller in equatorial region. Based on the work of Henyey etal (1986). This scheme should NOT be used if Bryan-Lewis is used. Default hwf_diffusivity=.false.

items.name: visc_cbu_back_zmid
items.description: Mid-point of tanh function used to define background vertical viscosity.

items.name: vmix_min_diss_flux_ri_max
items.description: Maximum flux Richardson number for computation of diffusivity from dissipation. Default vmix_min_diss_flux_ri_max=0.2.

items.name: aidif
items.description: aidif=1 for implicit in time solution of the vertical mixing equation. aidif=0 for explicit in time solution of the vertical mixing equation. semi-implicit method with 0 < aidif < 1 is not fully supported in MOM.

items.name: debug_this_module
items.description: For debugging purposes.

items.name: hwf_depth_transition
items.description: Depth of transition for hwf scheme.  The HWF method actually has no depth dependence.  But we include the atan depth dependency from Bryan-Lewis, for those cases where we wish to replace Bryan-Lewis with the HWF scheme.  To get the usual Bryan-Lewis transition, set hwf_depth_transition=2500.0.  However, since we often use hwf in the presence of tide mixing, we do not wish to have any depth dependence, in which case the default is hwf_depth_transition=2500.0e4.

items.name: hwf_diffusivity_3d
items.description: 3D background diffusivity which gets smaller in equatorial region. Based on the work of Henyey etal (1986). This form has not been used much at GFDL, with preference given to a simpler two-dimensional (depth independent) form assessed with the default hwf_diffusivity_3d=.false.

items.name: visc_cbu_back_min
items.description: For use in setting background vertical viscosity.

items.name: verbose_init
items.description: For verbose writes during initialization.

items.name: hwf_30_diffusivity
items.description: Diffusivity at 30deg latitude for the HWF scheme. Default hwf_30_diffusivity=2e-5.

items.name: use_diff_cbt_table
items.description: If .true., then read in a table that specifies (i,j,ktop-->kbottom) and the diffusivity. This method is useful when aiming to mix vertically at points where do cross-land insertion or where may wish to enhance mixing at river mouths.

items.name: vmix_rescale_nonbouss
items.description: To rescale the vertical mixing coefficients by rho0/rho in order to bring the effects from vertical diffusion in a non-Boussinesq model more in line with that from a Boussinesq model. Default vmix_rescale_nonbouss=.false.

items.name: diff_cbt_tanh_min
items.description: For use in setting background vertical diffusivity. Default diff_cbt_tanh_min=2e-5.

items.name: diff_cbt_tanh_zmid
items.description: Mid-point of tanh function used to define background vertical diffusivity. Default diff_cbt_tanh_zmid=150.0.

items.name: vmix_set_min_dissipation
items.description: To set a minimum dissipation rate.  This scheme will compute the dissipation from the full diffusivity.  If the resulting dissipation is smaller than a specified dissipation, then the diffusivity will be locally increased so that the min dissipation is maintained. Default vmix_set_min_dissipation=.false.

items.name: visc_cbu_back_max
items.description: For use in setting background vertical viscosity.

items.name: vert_visc_back
items.description: If .true. then include a static depth dependent vertical viscosity which is used only if running w/ constant vertical viscosity scheme. Standard application is when have a model with fine vertical resolution, yet no mixed layer scheme.  Wind stress must be spread deeper than the top cell, or the model may go unstable, or at the least it will produce spuriously large vertical shears.

items.name: diff_cbt_tanh
items.description: For enabling tanh background vertical diffusivity profile. Default diff_cbt_tanh=.false.

items.name: bryan_lewis_lat_transition
items.description: North/South latitude where transition from Bryan-Lewis values in the tropic to those in the higher latitudes.

items.name: bryan_lewis_lat_depend
items.description: If .true. then allow for Bryan-Lewis background to be different outside of a tropical band than inside the band.

items.name: vmix_min_diss_bvfreq_scale
items.description: Scaling use to set the minimum dissipation rate as determined by the local stratification. Default vmix_min_diss_bvfreq_scale=6e-4.

items.name: visc_cbu_back_pp
items.description: Background vertical viscosity

items.name: use_this_module
items.description: Must be true to use this module. Default is false.

items.name: fricmx
items.description: Maximum mixing

items.name: wndmix
items.description: Minimum viscosity at bottom of 1st level to simulate missing high frequency windstress components.

items.name: diff_cbt_back_pp
items.description: Space-time independent background vertical diffusivity thought to be that arising from internal waves. Note that if using Bryan-Lewis background diffusivity, then should set diff_cbt_back_pp=0.0.

items.name: roughness_scale
items.description: Scale for the roughness that characterizes the roughness affecting the tidal dissipation process. Used for setting roughness_length via roughness_length = kappa*h^2, with kappa = 2pi/(roughness_scale) and h=topography amplitude. Default roughness_scale=1e4 as in Jayne and St. Laurent (2001)

items.name: use_legacy_methods
items.description: To compute all mixing coefficients using legacy methods. There are good reasons to prefer the newer approaches, which motivates setting the default use_legacy_methods=.false.

items.name: drag_dissipation_tide_period
items.description: Characteristic tide period for use in computing efolding depth for the tide drag scheme.  Default = 12*60*60 = 12hours for semi-diurnal tide.

items.name: shelf_depth_cutoff
items.description: For use in defining a mask for the Simmons scheme, with depths shallower than shelf_depth_cutoff removed from the scheme. shelf_depth_cutoff=1000m in Simmons etal. Default shelf_depth_cutoff=-1000m so there is no cutoff.

items.name: tide_speed_data_on_t_grid
items.description: To set the input tide speed data on T-grid, set to true. Otherwise, set to false. Default tide_speed_data_on_t_grid=.true.

items.name: background_diffusivity
items.description: Background vertical diffusivity not accounted for by the tidal schemes nor any other scheme such as KPP.  Default=0.1e-4.

items.name: munk_anderson_p
items.description: The p constant in the Munk-Anderson scheme employed by Lee etal. This parameter is minus the "p_tide" parameter in the KPP schemes. Default munk_anderson_p=0.25

items.name: drag_dissipation_use_cdbot
items.description: For using the cdbot_array computed from ocean_bbc.F90 module. Default drag_dissipation_use_cdbot=.false., as this is consistent with earlier simulations.

items.name: read_tide_speed
items.description: If .true. then read in tidal speed (m/s) from a tidal model. This information is used for the computing the energy dissipation from tides. scheme.

items.name: fixed_wave_dissipation
items.description: If .true. then fix the wave dissipation from that read in by the tide model, such as Jayne and St.Laurent (2001). This power dissipation will be employed for computing wave induced mixing. Default fixed_wave_dissipation=.false.

items.name: speed_min
items.description: For the drag scheme, we set the diffusivity as well as the Richardson number to zero if the tide speed is less than speed_min.  This serves two purposes: 1/ to reduce overflows in some of the diagnostics; 2/ to set the drag induced diffusivity to zero in regions where the tide speed is small. Default speed_min=5e-3m/s.

items.name: drag_mask_deep_ratio
items.description: For determining the drag dissipation mask. The mask = 0 in regions where tide_depth/total_depth < drag_mask_deep_ratio Default drag_mask_deep_ratio=0.1

items.name: max_wave_diffusivity
items.description: Maximum tracer diffusivity deduced from the wave dissipation scheme from Simmons etal. Default = 5.e-3 m^2/sec.

items.name: read_leewave_dissipation
items.description: If .true. then read in leewave dissipation from a file. Default read_leewave_dissipation=.false.

items.name: debug_this_module
items.description: For debugging purposes.

items.name: mixing_efficiency_n2depend
items.description: Allow for mixing efficiency to be a function of N^2/(N^2+Omega^2), which is close to unity except in regions where N is very small. Default mixing_efficiency_n2depend=.false.

items.name: read_wave_dissipation
items.description: If .true. then read in wave dissipation computed from Jayne and St.Laurent (2001) tide model (or another model). Default read_wave_dissipation=.false.

items.name: decay_scale
items.description: In the Simmons etal vertical profile function, the exponential decay scale is determined by this parameter.  Default = 500m as in Simmons etal (2004).  This vertical profile determines how to deposit the internal wave energy within a vertical column.

items.name: max_drag_diffusivity
items.description: Maximum tracer diffusivity deduced from the drag dissipation scheme from Lee etal. Default = 5.e-3 m^2/sec.

items.name: wave_energy_flux_max
items.description: The maximum mechanical energy from internal tides that is provided for mixing.  Default wave_energy_flux_max=0.1Watt/m^2.

items.name: reading_roughness_length
items.description: If .true., then the field in the roughness file is roughness_length = kappa*h^2, with kappa a representative roughness wavelength and h a representative topographic amplitude.  This information is used for the Simmons etal wave dissipation parameterization. Default reading_roughness_length=.false.

items.name: mixing_efficiency
items.description: Fraction of energy that is dissipated which is converted into dianeutral diffusion of tracer.  Default=0.2 based on Osborn (1980).

items.name: read_roughness
items.description: If .true. then read in bottom roughness amplitude h, where roughness_length = kappa*h^2, with kappa a representative roughness wavelength and h a representative topographic amplitude.  This information is used for the Simmons etal wave dissipation parameterization.

items.name: smooth_rho_N2
items.description: For smoothing the rho_N2 field via a 1-2-1 filter in vertical.  This is useful to produce smoother diffusivities. Default is smooth_rho_N2=.true.

items.name: vel_micom_smooth
items.description: Velocity scale that is used for computing the MICOM Laplacian mixing coefficient used in the Laplacian smoothing of diffusivities. Default vel_micom_smooth=0.2.

items.name: drag_mask_deep
items.description: For masking out the deep ocean regions for the drag dissipation scheme.  This scheme is meant to apply only in shallow shelves, so it is physically relevant to mask it out.  We apply a mask as determined by the ratio of the frictional tide depth scale and the total ocean depth. Default drag_mask_deep=.true.

items.name: bottom_drag_cd
items.description: Bottom drag coefficient from Lee etal. Default bottom_drag_cd=2.4e-3

items.name: munk_anderson_sigma
items.description: The sigma constant in the Munk-Anderson scheme employed by Lee etal. This parameter is called "sigma_tide" in the KPP schemes. Default munk_anderson_sigma=3.0

items.name: drhodz_min
items.description: Minimum absolute value for the drhodz used to compute N^2 and rhoN2. This value is needed in order to regularize the diffusivity computed from the tide mixing schemes. Default is drhodz_min=1e-10, which is much smaller than the (N^2)min = 10^-8 sec^-2 used by Simmons etal. There is some sensitivity to the choice of drhodz_min, with larger values leading to reduced deep diffusivities, due to the N^-2 dependence in the diffusivity calculation.

items.name: tidal_diss_efficiency
items.description: Fraction of barotropic tidal energy that is dissipated locally, as opposed to that which propagates away.  Default=1/3 as in Simmons etal (2004).

items.name: wave_diffusivity_monotonic
items.description: Enforce a monotonic decay of the wave dissipation diffusivity, with largest values near bottom and smaller as move to shallower water.  This behaviour is not guaranteed in general, since the division by the buoyancy frequency can give non-monotone diffusivities. Default wave_diffusivity_monotonic=.true.

items.name: default_roughness_length
items.description: Default value for kappa*h^2 = roughness length for use in the absence of a roughness length dataset. MOM default is default_roughness_length=25.0m.

items.name: default_tide_speed
items.description: Default value for tidal speed for use in the absence of a value from a tidal model.

items.name: reading_roughness_amp
items.description: If .true., then the field in the roughness file is roughness_amp=h, where roughness_length=kappa*h^2. This information is used for the Simmons etal wave dissipation parameterization. Default reading_roughness_amp=.false.

items.name: smooth_bvfreq_bottom
items.description: For smoothing the buoyancy frequency at the bottom. Default smooth_bvfreq_bottom=.true.

items.name: num_121_passes
items.description: Number of passes of 1-2-1 filter in vertical for smoothing the rho_N2 field. Default num_121_passes=1.

items.name: background_viscosity
items.description: Background vertical viscosity not accounted for by the tidal schemes nor any other scheme such as KPP.  Default=0.1e-4.

items.name: drag_dissipation_efold
items.description: For setting an efolding whereby the drag dissipation diffusivity exponentially decreases as move upward in the water column. There are good reasons to set this logical to true, as the scheme can produce unreasonably large diffusivities far from the bottom, if there are tides in the deep ocean. Default drag_dissipation_efold=.true.

items.name: num_n2_smooth
items.description: For vertical smoothing N2 for Richardson number. Default num_n2_smooth = 1.

items.name: debug_this_module
items.description: For debugging purposes.

items.name: smooth_n2
items.description: For vertical smoothing the N2 calculation for Richardson number. Default smooth_n2 = .true.

items.name: num_ri_smooth
items.description: For vertical smoothing richardson number. Default num_ri_smooth = 1.

items.name: smooth_ri_number
items.description: For vertical smoothing richardson number. Default smooth_ri_number = .true.
